| **Origin/Pathogenesis** | *Nocardia* are **strict aerobes** <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:44:52">[00:44:52]</a> found in the environment (soil) <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:28">[00:45:28]</a>. Infection typically occurs via inhalation <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:46:21">[00:46:21]</a>. They can mimic [[tuberculosis | TB]] in terms of pulmonary symptoms <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:46:49">[00:46:49]</a>, but usually lack lymphadenopathy <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:50:29">[00:50:29]</a>. | *Actinomyces* are **strict anaerobes** <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:00">[00:45:00]</a> and are part of the normal endogenous flora of the mouth <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:38">[00:45:38]</a>. Infections often follow trauma or dental procedures like tooth extraction <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:40">[00:45:40]</a>. They can also be associated with Intrauterine Contraceptive Devices (IUCDs) <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:46:01">[00:46:01]</a>. | **NOrigin/Pathogenesis** | *Nocardia* are **strict aerobes** <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:44:52">[00:44:52]</a> found in the environment (soil) <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:28">[00:45:28]</a>. Infection typically occurs via inhalation <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:46:21">[00:46:21]</a>. They can mimic [[tuberculosis | TB]] in terms of pulmonary symptoms <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:46:49">[00:46:49]</a>, but usually lack lymphadenopathy <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:50:29">[00:50:29]</a>. | *Actinomyces* are **strict anaerobes** <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:00">[00:45:00]</a> and are part of the normal endogenous flora of the mouth <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:38">[00:45:38]</a>. Infections often follow trauma or dental procedures like tooth extraction <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:45:40">[00:45:40]</a>. They can also be associated with Intrauterine Contraceptive Devices (IUCDs) <a class="yt-timestamp" data-t="00:46:01">[00:46:01]</a>.
